name: Richard Sessums
text: My daughter attends AU and she (and her parents) are so very happy that she is there.  We looked at a lot of schools before she chose AU.... and she is so glad that she did.  The environment and people are awesome, everybody is so friendly and helpful.  Our official college tour was not very good though.

name: Garnett Leithart
text: Dr. Celebi was a wonderful doctor!! Super good at explaining the treatment we were going through with, and I got my braces off early! Thanks so much UAB! :D

name: vkutz
text: Have been coming here for years. This is an excellent school that does exceptional work by junior and senior students. Everything is double, triple, and quadruple checked by professors (doctors). Just have patience and your wallet will thank you!

resp.text: Excellence is important to us and we thank you for sharing your experience!

name: Brie Nicole
text: My experience with the Orthodontist department has been great. They are very friendly and made having braces easy and enjoyable! I would recommend them to anybody!

name: Sara Fernandez
text: My last experience was in. 2008, I made an appointment with the school after getting 2 estimates from regular dentists. I had an injury and chipped my front tooth. $1,500.00 was my estimate, well the awesome students fixed my tooth amazingly beautiful for $60.00. Well now it's 2021, I am going back for a lot of dental work and I'm sure, without a doubt, I will be pleased. Students do the work but with the dentist professor's overlooking. ❤️

name: Molly Pudner
text:
I first started coming to UAB Dentistry because I couldn't afford private practice dental work without insurance but so far I've loved it more than any other dentist I've ever seen. When you register as a patient you're assigned a student who will be working with you (under faculty supervision.) Mine is Valerie Castro and she is AMAZING, very competent and sweet. She has also been very gracious and willing to talk to me about any concerns or questions at any time outside our scheduled appointments. Wherever she goes after graduation, I will definitely be recommending her to everyone I know.

I also had a root canal done by resident Nathan Nunnalee and thought he was amazing as well. Saw me the same day when I first came in with pain (which I understand he was not obligated to do), did an amazing job and was happy to explain the process as well as answer any questions I had throughout the procedure.

I haven't worked with every student and staff member in the facility but if those two (as well as the other student and faculty members I HAVE met) are any indication, I would recommend UAB Dentistry to any patient for any reason, regardless of insurance status or price range. The affordability is just a nice bonus.

name: Robin Rivera
text: Billing department is a nightmare! Almost 2 years still have not received reimbursement for work both my insurance company and I have paid for. Rude! No accountability. Very unprofessional.

name: Apple Joy
text:
Patients beware! This is a fraud, cheating facility that patient should never go!!!
I went there for a tooth cleaning. My dental insurance has 100% coverage for tooth cleaning and scaling. However, after the scaling (measuring the depth of the gum), they did NOT clean my teeth. Instead they made an appointment at a different time for a "deep cleaning". They charged $1,000 for it and I rejected the appointment right away. However, they charged this un-done tooth cleaning with only scaling " parlodontal evaluation" and charged the insurance company $100 and $30 copay to me while they should only charge the insurance company a "scaling" and $0 to me. This is a fraud facility and patient should never go there for your dental!

name: Jessika Tidwell
text: Very sweet and caring staff! Great experience!

name: YakBurner
text: Service is okay, but they are horrid at answering the phone or even calling you back. Have called 4-5  in the past week and left voicemails with no call back.

name: Eric Leong
text: Why would you post a schedule saying you close @5PM if you're closed earlier?

name: Joni Valentine
text: Love Dr kau an his staff!! See us quickly and are always very nice!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your rating, Joni. Dr. Kau and the whole team are glad you had a 5-star experience.

name: nestor gonzalez
text: On May 15, I went to the clinic because I had severe pain in one of my molars, and the only thing they did to me was to take x-rays and nothing else, they did not check my mouth inside and they said that was all, ask what I do. To reduce the pain, they said to take advil and to call on Monday to make another appointment, I think that if you go for an emergency, at least they have to check you or do something, I could not spend more days with the pain that did not go away with me. nothing, in short, I arrived with pain and I went home just like that unpleasant experience

resp.text: We are sorry to hear your experience did not meet expectations. For the safety of our patients and providers, the school is operating under COVID-19 emergency protocol at this time. While we are not able to share information related to patient care, we welcome you to contact your treatment team to discuss your concerns and schedule any follow up.

name: Cortney Wilbanks
text: I had a wonderful experience at the UAB dental school clinic this am. Both primary dental student  and oral specialist residents were superb and got me through quickly and efficiently. Definitely glad that I did not wait the recommended 2 weeks given to me by Cahaba dental to get my issues resolved!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing, Cortney. We are proud that you had a wonderful experience at UAB Dentistry.

name: Krystal Bost
text:
In 2014 I had a terribly abscessed tooth that suddenly started hurting like the devil himself was attempting to rearrange my brain via my jaw. It was excruciating, to say the very least. My usual dentist could not see me in an acceptable amount of time, and I was also traveling to Birmingham for school daily-- about an hour and a half drive, one way-- so I begged the internet to help me find a dentist who could pull a tooth of a horribly anxiety ridden terrified patient who might look like an adult but retreated into toddler status when confronted by dental tools, and one who I could afford, as I had no insurance to speak of. They overwhelmingly recommended UAB dental school clinic, so I called up the emergency dental clinic and begged for an appointment asap. They got me in the next day, but were not able to provide me with any kind of ballpark estimate for the procedure, which I already knew would be a complex extraction on a molar and would require nitrous and a calm provider. It was actually kind of rough dealing with their administrative staff, both on the phone and in person. I realize these people see patients from all walks of life and a lot of them are scared, in pain, broke, and in need of a compassionate ally. The office staff was not that ally for me, unfortunately. I arrived for my appointment, filled out paperwork, and proceeded to wait about three hours before I was seen, which I understand is normal. I was already crying by the time they got me into the chair, but my student provider was really, really kind, and she held my hand and talked to me and distracted me with ridiculous jokes until I could calm down a little. She examined my mouth, then the area of complaint. She wrote down what she thought the treatment plan should be to address the problem, and took it to her supervisor dentist and he did a quick exam and approved it. She started with the numbing shots which were actually the least painful numbing shots I've ever had. That shocked me! And y'all, before I even realized she was done with the shots, she had my tooth snatched right out of me!! I did not even have to use nitrous! It was the fastest extraction I've ever had, and I've had A FRIGGIN BUNCH. That part of my experience was phenomenal. They hooked me up with some antibiotics and sent me on my way.
My bill ended up being$300+ for one extraction. If I'm being honest, I've paid less than that at private dentists that were a whole lot closer to me. That part wasn't so great, as I'd been led to believe this was a less costly alternative to private dentists.
Overall, a good experience, I would return for like routine cleanings, and am considering taking my daughter to the orthodontic clinic. I currently need extensive work done, I need bone grafts and implants and all kinds of awful stuff, uggggg, but I hesitate to say I'm comfortable going here only because they were not transparent about pricing, and that matters for me. I would consider a free consultation, but I don't think they offer one, just a heads up. Good luck, I hope whoever reads this gets their dental issues solved quickly and easily 🖤

name: Dk Dk
text: Wonderful experience here. Dr. Yassim in the prostadontics department is the best, most caring ,kindest dentist I've ever had. Dr. Fu is great. The office staff is pleasant and helpful. I highly recommend the dental school.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback. The team here at UAB Dentistry strives for excellence so we are proud that you had a five-star experience.

name: S. Davis
text: great dentistry place to come for me.

name: robin woodgett
text:
On May 18 2020 I arrived with severe pain which was causing my bp to be extremely high. After 3 hours of sitting waiting and X-ray I was taking up stairs to oral surgery where I waited 45 minutes. Once I was in the back the assistant (she was very nice) came in and took my bp again and told me the doctor will be in soon. When the doctor came in he didn’t speak nor  introduce himself. Talking in an aggressive tone, He said, “I’m going to let the chair back. Now open your mouth.” After checking out the tooth that was causing pain I begun asking him a question about another tooth but he rudely stopped me in the middle of my question aggressively saying “No I’m not doing that today I’m just going to take that tooth out.” I said, “okay”. The equipment was already in the room so he grabbed the needle and begun to numb me. (This is not my first time getting a tooth pulled) He stuck the needle in swiftly moving it around in my gum fast as he was pushing it further in applying lots of pressure. I know I was in pain and needles never feels good but the way he handle me was rough. As I sat there with tears going down my face and in more pain than what I came with. He didn’t give it at least 1 minute to kick in. Right after he was getting ready to pull my tooth. I told him it wasn’t numb because I was rubbing and pushing my tongue against my gum and tooth, I could feel it. Sounding angry He stated “it should be numb!” By this time the assistant came in asking me “are you okay?” I couldn’t respond. The doctor put down the tools to pull and numbed me again he shoved the needle in on the inter side of my gum applying extra pressure/force. I was holding still as possible, but the force of him pushing was pushing my head back. After that torture I stated “I don’t want to do this!” the doctor threw the tools down on the table and started to walk out he stopped at the door because the assistant stated “you half way there let’s get it out.” I stated “ he been rude rough and aggressive since he been in here. I scared of him.He don’t have any compassion nor consideration at all”. In a very nasty tone the doctor then said “ it not my fault you need your tooth pulled. It’s not my you don’t take care of your teeth. You the one that needs your tooth pulled not me.”  I asked him “ are you okay? Are you stressed or over worked? Because I felt the tension soon as you walked in the room.” The doctor the stated “you already in pain so it’s going to hurt. You should’ve brushed your teeth”. The assistant then intervened saying “let’s just get you out of pain it will be over soon”. I agreed. The doctor tone of voice got a lot nicer afterwards. Going off the name on my RX bottle his name is Cameron Walsh, Den. It was a nightmare with him.
The building was nice and clean. All the other employees was nice compassionate and understanding.

resp.text: At UAB Dentistry we always strive for excellence. We thank you for sharing your feedback. While we are not able to share information related to patient care, we welcome you to also contact your clinic to discuss your concerns.

name: Nick
text:
My experience with the school of dentistry is that they're either blindingly incompetent or outright liars.

I went there for a checkup after not going to the dentist for several years and was told that I had periodontal pocketing at 5mm in 2 spots, several 4mm, and needed a deep cleaning in all four quadrants ASAP. The "pocketing" progressed over the two years that I went there despite my best efforts to keep my mouth clean. I didn't understand this, as I was and still am a young man, and the supposed pocketing was advancing even in previously healthy areas.

I was told after 2 years of seeing them every 3 months and 2 separate full mouth scaling and root planings that my pockets had somehow worsened since my last checkup a mere 3 months ago from 5 mm in a couple spots to as far as 7 mm in several spots in all 4 quadrants and I would need full mouth gum cutting surgery(flap surgery) to the tune of over $2,000. Keep in mind that multiple dental professors were overseeing the students that told me this and confirmed their diagnosis every step of the way.

It was at this point that I finally understood that something was off about what they were telling me and went to an established periodontist. I did NOT tell this periodontist anything about my experience so far, only that I had received troubling news from another dentist and would like for my pockets to be measured. I had one 5mm spot and everywhere else was a 4 at worst. She recommended laser surgery in just that ONE quadrant with a 5mm pocket. I'm honestly not even sure I needed THAT after my experience at UAB, but I didn't want to take any chances with my teeth.

It's been over 3 years since I last went to the school of dentistry. To reiterate, they told me that I needed gum surgery and that I would likely lose all of my teeth in no time flat if I didn't do it. That my pockets would worsen and worsen at the same rate they supposedly were(4-5 mm to 7 mm in the time span of 3 months). Since then, my pockets have not gotten any worse, and in some areas have gotten much better. I have a few 4mm now that I have to clean diligently and that's it. I still have all of my teeth. I DO have tooth pain now, and I DO have gum recession now, but it's ONLY in areas that were previously healthy. For example, my two upper front teeth had no pockets or recession whatsoever at any time, even as measured by UAB. They still don't have any pockets, but after being needlessly scaled twice, the gums have receded ever so slightly and I have ugly pinholes in between my teeth. I am convinced that the only reason they ever receded in the first place was my treatment at UAB, as they have not before or since.

Going to this place was one of the biggest mistakes of my life. I feel as if I paid them for the privilege of being a test subject. If I had continued trusting what they told me, I would have had completely unnecessary and irrevocable full mouth surgery. My smile would have been permanently damaged. I have a VERY hard time understanding how so many different people there could all have had SO many different measuring mistakes of the magnitude they did. Both the periodontist and dentist I go to now tell me I have no worrying pockets and never had any except in that one quadrant.

I did have some other work done here as well, and as far as I know it was fine and they did a good job, but my experience RE the recommended surgery based on wrong...or fudged, not sure if that's better or worse...measurements makes me question everything they did.

I hope my wording isn't too harsh, and I did experience plenty of professional and caring people there, as it's a huge clinic, but I do feel very strongly about almost going through with a life-changing surgery at my own expense only to find out from other professionals that it wasn't necessary. If I hadn't gotten a second and third opinion, I may very well have, and my teeth wouldn't have ever looked right again.

I ultimately would not advise going to this clinic unless you have no other choice.

name: Ross Roberts
text: I have read a few bad reviews on here and those did not reflect my experience at all. Aside from the wait which was understandable there was nothing to complain about. The staff was very friendly. It was a good experience for me.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback. We always strive for excellence and are proud that you had a positive experience.

name: Kevin Watkins
text: My wife had the privilege of being a patient there. She had a major problem with her teeth which had died due to strong pain meds after a broken back and infusion surgery. She saw Dakota a senior student there which was extraordinary in every aspect of his care of my wife. He made her very comfortable and was very professional. He made her the most beautiful set of dentures she could have ever dreamed possible. Well here we are 3 years down the road and her dentures are still perfect and she has never had to have any adjustments to either plate. Thank you all so much for being so wonderful with my wife Kim. Sincerely Kevin

resp.text: The UAB Dentistry team strives for excellence and we are so proud that you had a great experience. Thank you for sharing.

name: Stanly Moon
text: Because they are very friendly

name: Lashonda Gordon
text: I was a little skeptical about going but I'm so glad I did. My student dentist, Undine Davis, was very kind, patient, and professional.  She explained everything to me and even did some routine dental procedures my hometown dentist has never done. I was there for 4 hours but none of my time was wasted. She was thorough with my consultation and I'm looking forward to returning for my next procedure.  I highly recommend UAB school of dentistry and hope to be a patient of Mrs. Davis one day

name: emily wray
text: Aside from my daughter having a COMPLETE  meltdown over the xrays, we had a pleasant experience. The drs are amazing and kind and so patient. I highly recommend them. 😊

resp.text: Thank you for sharing, Emily. The team here at UAB Dentistry strives for excellence so we are proud that you had a great experience!

name: Bunky Mercado
text:
I know how important these medical reviews are so I'll try to be as accurate and nice as possible.
I took my wife here to get the $80 evaluation and a second opinion on $7,000 worth of work from my local periodontist. We left 3 hours later with little to no information. They suggested we come back and visit  the different specialties practiced. They wouldn't even consider looking over the X-rays or records we brought with us. The place and inexperienced students really gave us an uneasy feeling. It has a clinic style atmosphere with the majority of patients being elderly, disabled and very low income.
I understand that these are young students and looking at some of the reviews here there are mistakes that have been made, some serious. If you don't have insurance this may be a risk worth taking but for us it's not.

name: stephen graham
text: I went to UAB School of Dentistry today and had an absolutely fantastic experience. I was in extreme pain for last couple of days with a broken tooth that had become infected, they got me right in, right back at that same day and took care of my problem, staff was out of this world nice, went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable, I would absolutely recommend this place to anybody with any kind of dental needs they are absolutely the best. I will definitely be back for all my dental work in the future thank you to the UAB School of Dentistry and all you fine people that work there. A big thank you.

name: Drewbie UnderFire
text:
This place is just a school, and they will use you as a guinea pig.

My father has been in and out this place time after time after time for the last two years. He has had his teeth pulled, then dentures fitted, then promised impants to be scheduled.

His teeth were pulled. little. by. little. With miniscule medication.

His phone calls were returned. Occasionally.

We are currently taking legal action against this institution as they are in little contact with us and no longer care to hear his stories about the pain he is experiencing.

And oh, is there pain. It takes every bit of strength he can muster just to get to the local store for something soft to eat (when his hunger can outweigh his pain) and then lay back down to mitigate his suffering.

If you want to save some money and be thrown at the mercy of people who really don't care about you, make an appointment.

name: Stephanie Salazar
text: We chose the school of dentistry  for my father’s dentures because he heard a couple of people were happy so he would try it. The price was great, however they completely underestimated the amount of time it would take to complete the process and canceled appointments, postponed appointments, lost appointments and he is now being told he can’t finish the process until the next school cycle starts in July. This will make it a year in the process and he still does not have dentures.  His health is so frail he’s afraid he’s going to die before he gets them.  We are so unhappy.  He now has an infection from the extractions that would have been found if they were paying closer attention with follow up Instead of canceling appointments because they’re too busy. The only way we found it was going to another dentist for denture eval. Not going back again. I’m not afraid to say this was for Ronald Ellerbe. Look it up UAB.

resp.text: Hi Stephanie, We are sorry to hear about the experience you and your father had. We welcome you to contact your treatment team to discuss your concerns.

name: Selma Sanchez
text:
I went to the clinic because it would be affordable to me and I have extensive work to be done..I was interviewed and checked by Ms Michelle ( in her shirt was written Mesha I believe.She was supervised and instructed when needed bu Dr Haven( not sure about the spelling) I went to the clinic after going to a couple of dentist in my area and realizing that I could not afford them.I read that the clinic was less expensive.
I was interviewed and checked during the morning but then something changed and the student that have even been instructed to get impressions on my teeth and bite etc..sitted me upright like she was done and started telling me about a couple of options but I could not follow her and ask her to write it down for me to compare..I also asked her if the clinic  would help me with a temporary (of course paying for it) and she said that she has to ask.
After that she came back wirh another dr ( I believe his name is Perng-Ru Liu, DDS, MS and he is a proffesor and Chairman) with after a ligth examination and a discourse about how "one can not expect to built a mansion over poor foundation" proceed to expel me from the programm citing the fact that my case was to "complex".Nobody has told me that I was under evaluation...as a matter of fact they already studied my case after my first visit, interview, examination, panoramic and individual Xrays that has happened more than a month ago..I even had another appointment already for next week on the 8th of August.And Messha told me they have studied my case
So he denied me access to an affordable (to me) care.I asked him if I could get a root canal and fillings that I need what he refused saying that it was better for me to get everything in one place although he knows that it is usually done by different specialists.
In a word he was cruel and dismissive of my situation when he could have been so helpful.If it has been his private practice I would not object but it is not the case..I was never told that somebody else has to approve my treatments and I think it was an abuse of his power as Chairman..He probably thought that I would not be able to talk for myself..but even though my English is not perfect and can communicate and tell how unfair his behavior was...The only other thing that I can think of is that I mention that I have been to a Dr that was wonderful but I could not afford her and I mention her name...but ot will bw unfair as well to banned me from their care since I can not afford the other one.
Anyway..this was my experience at the School of Dentistry and specially with
Perng-Ru Liu. God forgive him

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear you had an experience that did not meet expectations. While we are not able to share information related to patient care, we welcome you to contact your treatment team to discuss your concerns and appropriate treatment.

name: Carol G
text: Service is great but very lacking in returning phone calls. One voice mail said at her convenience which was never and others say call will be returned within 24 hours and that didn't happen either. I've called many times and have yet to talk with someone.

name: Bubba Beard
text: I have been going through the process of receiving temporary dentures and dental implants for 14 months. I have been put off time after time with rescheduling as my mouth pain continues to make my life a living hell. I am extremely disappointed with the prosthodontics department, but the oral surgeon has been understanding. I've been promised my temporary dentures again, yet here I am facing a three day weekend in pain. My advice is to document all conversations and correspondence with UAB School of Dentistry.

name: Mrs. Sullivan
text: I like them they get the job done and most of the students is about to be finish with school.  So there it is you can easy go to a private practice and the can do the same work with to supervision.   It's a good place.

name: Henry James
text: Had a very small room waiting to see dentist,even though I am in a moble chair 🙂

name: krynn clark
text: The receptionist was rude. Dropped my husband off to get his tooth pulled. When he got quoted on the price we realized we couldnt afford over 300 bucks for the registration fees and the extraction plus the use of any numming shots. So i scheduled the appointment somewhere else. We he went to return his paperwork the lady said "oh you realized you weren't just gonna be able to get pain meds here?" As if he's a drug addict wanting pills. We will never even think to use this place nor will I ever advise someone to go.

name: Randi Capleton
text: Had a root canal 5+ years ago and I am now finding out there is still root left in the tooth. Went to the Endodontics today and was told the tooth could not be saved and I am now having to have it pulled. This is a perfect example of you get what you pay for. I will never be back or have a loved one there. Please let these students work on others that don't need there teeth.

name: Carla Henry
text: I am currently a patient at the school for cosmetic work..veneers they are very affordable and the student Kori she is wonderful..yes you spend a lot of time there and multiple visits so be prepared if you are very impatient this might not be for you..crowns are $500 a piece ... composite veneers are$150 a piece which is definitely not bad ..hope this helps

name: stephanie grayson heffner
text: My son chipped his front tooth working out at school and they fixed it back so perfect its like it never happened and had a cavity filled in less than an hour!! AMAZING WORK!

name: Micah Allison
text:
My children’s orthodontist and orthodontic students get five stars which is the only reason they got more than one star review. Their billing department are the most incompetent people on the planet. They have a owed me a partial refund for both of my children for well over a year (due to BCBS process of having to PIF before they bill and pay for each visit)..  For one of them, they can’t seem to properly communicate with our insurance company in order to get it billed properly. My other son, they supposedly sent me a refund check over a year ago that never arrived. Since October 2017, I have communicated with their offices at least a dozen times, several times in person in their office.  Every single time, they have told me that they will re-issue the check but this has never been done. Numerous times they have blamed it on not having my correct address, but the fact is they have no problem getting bills to my address. Every time I confirm my current address with them,  they supposedly input it into the system. At one point, they input an address that was virtually unrecognizable when compared to my actual address (apparently Plaza De Toros is too difficult for some people, even when spelled out!). The last time I was in there, they told me that the check was in an office across street and has been sitting there for the last year.   It would have been nice to know that I could just go over there and pick it up each and every time I have been at their building. Unfortunately, they tell me that no patients/ customers are allowed to go to that office. That makes sense, as it stands to reason that some people would more aggressive measures than I over a business’ complete lack of sense and ability to properly handle another person’s hard earned money. (I on the other hand, have resorted to an internet review, though I’m close to taking it to a courthouse But I digress). The last time I was there, this secret office was supposedly closed. They promised me that they would have a check overnighted the next day. That was nearly 2 weeks ago.  I simply cannot fathom how so many people in a single department can be as incompetent as these people are. At one point, they sent me a bill for my son’s dentistry work- the same son under which account the refund is owed. I wrote on their bill,  “Perhaps when you send the refund that you have owes of me for over a year, I will pay your bill .”  I placed the annoyed bill and a copy of their letter stating they owe me a refund in the return envelope and mailed it back to them. I never received so much as a phone call inquiring of why their customer service is such a disaster and how they can help.  My youngest son will be finishing up his orthodontic care there only because it has all been paid in full. Other than that, I will never utilize their services again, nor would I ever recommend them to anyone.
That being said, Dr. Marcello is fabulous. Too bad she’s a student Dr, which makes her only temporary. She’s a temporary shining star.

name: Debbie emerson
text: The orthodontic clinic was fine. The parking is horrendous and getting worse every time we go!!! I would not recommend this until they get the parking situation under control! It is bad when you drop off your child and there is absolutely NO where to pay and park!!! You cannot even go to Mcdonalds and buy something and wait for them to call you to pick them up. You really need to provide parking for paying customers!!!!!!!

name: Beth Fiorucci
text: My adult, asperger daughter has been to UAB School of Dentistry several times now.  Her initial visit was with Dr. Kentros and Dr. Pignataro at the Dental Hospital.  They are exceptional.  They are caring and explained everything very well as to what needed to be done for her.  Their office staff is very friendly, as well.  Due to bad hygiene (not uncommon with aspergers), all of my daughter's teeth had to be extracted.  The staff at the Oral Surgery office was great, also.  We now have to return every few weeks to prepare for dentures.  I am sure we will be very pleased with the outcome.

name: Billy West
text: I made the mistake of having dental work here.  Everything was fine until I needed Teeth pulled.  I spent over two hours in chair being manhandled by Students.  Where was the supervision.  I had two teeth cut from the bone to have a partial installed later.  The pain has been excruciating with little medication.  A week later after running out of medication and pain was still persisting, I returned to the school and was told everything looked ok even though The pain had extended into my jaw, temple , and side of skull.  I was given 8 tabs of pain medication.  I explained I lived 125 miles away and had ran out of pain meds before, to no avail.  3 days later and I'm out of meds and in excruciating pain still.  I called the emergency line at 10 am est. , explained my situation, and was told someone from the faculty would contact me soon.  Here I sit 8 hours later without a return call.  Luckily I was able to get an emergency appointment with my previous dentist that afternoon and my pain was taken care of temporarily.  I cannot return to this school for the additional dental work I need because of their lack of follow up with patients.  I feel that if there was proper supervision in the oral surgery department, this incicdent may not have happened.  Also during the procedure, a tooth that was supposed to support and end of the partial had been turned, was loose, and would not support the partial now.  I will probably loose this tooth also.  Do yourself a favor if you can afford it, don't go there.

name: TANY
text: I would just like to say that, while UAB is an exceptional school when it comes to medical things (or science in general, really), I fully expected to leave UAB School of Dentistry underwhelmed, in massive debt, and belittled by some kid younger than me. Not only was I totally wrong, but I was pleasantly surprised in every way. The waits were no where near as long as I thought it'd be, everyone was SO FREAKING NICE (like, unbelievably nice. which is insane because i have ugly, crooked, and cavity-ridden teeth and have been scolded by every dentist ever until today), it wasn't terribly expensive (I am only in semi-debt to my mother, not The System), and they did everything in their power to make me comfortable. AND I got a real dentist, not a student, because all the dentistry students were off for the day for something(?)!! He was completely overwhelmed with the amount of people who came to have their teeth pulled today, and the dentist STILL took the time to see me because he could tell I was in a massive amount of pain. I also may have promised my nurse and her sister my employee discount because I was so drugged up and happy when she told me they were "Platos-obsessed" haha? But oh well! Basically, I have never been so happy with the service I received for anything, ever, and I am eating successfully for the first time since Tuesday (mashed potatoes are my best friend) and I bet I'll sleep tonight, too!! So happy I could cry right now. . .

name: Kenneth Hutson
text: I came there in August to get 3 dental implants no   one ever told me how long it would take take till they pulled 3 teeth and pull off most of all my caps  then told me it would be at least 12-16 more months now it looks like I bomb went off my mouth I am going to have to find a dentist to fix the mess

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback. We are very sorry to hear you had an experience that did not meet expectations. While we are not able to share information related to patient care, we welcome you to contact your treatment team to discuss your concerns.

name: Mr Ellias
text: I had a emergency tooth extraction here. The women pulled the wrong tooth saddest day off my life.

name: Jeremy McDonald
text: I had an appointment in the morning got there and signed in and was told my appointment was cancelled.I was told that they had called and left me a message but i never even received a call and no message was ever left.Then I asked about a reschedule but was told they did not know when the student might be back.This is the second time this has happened in two months.UAB dental clinic is not very professional at all.My advice would be to go to the Foundry or a private doctor.If you read the reviews they only comment on the so called (positive) reviews.Very unprofessional.

name: willie armstrong
text: They always on time when you need them

name: Bennetta Fuller
text: The Staff is very Patient and Caring! Best Medical Professionals!!!!

name: Badchopsuey
text: Affordable and quality

name: Mr Magestic (Mr. Majestic)
text: When I questioned the care I received there, I was told to seek treatment elsewhere and refused a refund for a downpayment of services that would not be rendered.

name: Janeth Vazquez
text:
(Translated by Google) All the staff is friendly

(Original)
Todo el personal es amable

name: Rafael Colin
text:
(Translated by Google) Excellent with affordable prices and with very good dentists 100% in quality and hygiene

(Original)
Exelente con precios accesibles y con muy buenos dentistas 100% en calidad e higiene

name: John Petersen
text: Pretty good food. It is a little expensive if you don't have swipes, but its best quality is that you can get more food than the Trojan Center per meal. It is socially distanced now and cleaned for COVID guidelines. The best day are Fried Chicken Wednesday.

name: Ishtiaq Khan
text: Different Menu everyday throughout the week and excellent food.

name: April Beasley
text: Food was delicious, and the servers were super fast and great!!

name: Kaitlyn Jordan
text: Food is great !! But the head Manager treats employees bad.. needs to be dealt with.

name: Suraj Thapa Magar
text: This is your go-to place for healthy and nutritional food. A little bit more variety couldn't hurt.

name: Anthony Roberts
text: For the week I was here with summer camps, the food was excellent. The staff was super helpful and friendly.

name: Pratiksha Joshi
text: The food is okay. There's a lot of  variety

name: Josias Clean11
text: the food is the tastyiesyt food
